channel.title: Softwares on Blog of Random things
channel.description: Recent content in Softwares on Blog of Random things

item.title: How fast can I read?
item.description: Computer storage has changed so much over last few decades, in both size and speed terms. We see a lot of amazing performance test results for NVMe drives nowadays. We could copy files much faster from one place to another. But what does it mean for software developers? How fast we shall expect our code to read? The following is some test results I have done in Java. The data file I am trying to read is the GDELT 1.
